activity.title: openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-explorer#180
activity.text:
> [@akashshetty1997](https://github.com/akashshetty1997) if you know how to fix those issue on search-a-licious side, it is more than welcome !

Yes! I'd be happy to help with that.
I understand that fixing this would require changing how <searchalicious-results> builds templates (avoiding the use of new Function() at runtime) to make it CSP-compatible.

activity.title: openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-explorer#180
activity.text:
> [@akashshetty1997](https://github.com/akashshetty1997) is CSP triggered even when adding the web-components repo as a dependency and using it locally?

Yes, CSP still blocks it even when installed locally.
It's because <searchalicious-results> uses new Function() at runtime, and CSP blocks dynamic code evaluation by default.

open_prs.title: Console Error After Denying Location Permission on Product Page
